evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew is evident in the preliminary historical data for Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25, indicating the issue was present and observable during this timeframe.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew remains a valid root cause despite potential alternative explanations, as the evidence from Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 strongly supports this factor and no defeaters sufficiently contradict it.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, such as miscommunication, delayed responses, and coordination lapses among crew members.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew is evident in the preliminary historical data for Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25, indicating the issue was present and observable during this timeframe.

defeaters: Direct evidence of communication or coordination failures among crew during the event
Explicit reports or recordings indicating breakdowns in communication or coordination

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence shows communication between flight crew and headset operator and interaction between tug instructor and trainee, but no direct indication of communication or coordination breakdown among the crew; the incident of the aircraft moving beyond the TRP suggests a possible issue but does not clearly demonstrate communication breakdown (H1-H4).
outcome.uncertainty_source: absence of explicit evidence describing communication or coordination failures; ambiguity in interpreting the incident as caused by communication breakdown

node.statement: Mechanical/control failure was present in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 during hist_t0_prelim.

defeaters: Direct evidence of mechanical or control failure in the aircraft during the event
Maintenance or system logs indicating failure
Witness statements explicitly describing mechanical/control failure

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.
After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence describes the pushback operation and the aircraft moving beyond the TRP and hitting a barrier, but does not mention any mechanical or control failure of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA. The continued movement beyond the TRP occurred with the engine at idle, but no direct evidence of mechanical/control failure is provided (H1-H4).
outcome.uncertainty_source: No direct evidence about mechanical/control failure is present; the cause of the aircraft moving beyond the TRP is not specified.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with key features identified in Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 historical data, reflecting deviations from standard pushback protocols.

Moving beyond TRP and hitting the blast barrier constitutes a procedural deviation
defeaters: If evidence showed the pushback was executed strictly according to standard protocols without deviation
